DOC.HEADLINE: WEST VALLEY FOCUS : CALABASAS ; HARVARD SCHOLAR TO OPEN SOKA LECTURES
DOC.TEXT: A talk by Cornel West , a professor of religion and African American studies at Harvard_University , will launch Soka University ' s Human_Rights Lecture Series . West , a scholar of institutional racism , is the author of such works as " Race Matters , " " Keeping Faith : Philosophy of Race in America " and " Prophecy Deliverance ! An Afro-American Revolutionary Christianity. " He will speak at 7 p.m. Oct . 24 at the Soka ' s Calabasas campus , 26800 W . Mulholland Highway . Future topics in the lecture series , which will continue through next year , include vegetarianism and solar activity . For more information , call ( 818 ) 878-3780 . MAKI BECKER
